title: Pakistan committed to peace but will not tolerate aggression: Rana Sanaullah
content:
LAHORE, Oct 18 (APP):Adviser to the Prime Minister on Political Affairs Senator Rana Sanaullah Khan has said that Pakistan’s policy towards its neighbours is based on peace and mutual respect, but any act of aggression against the country would be met with a strong and decisive response.
Talking to the media after visiting the residence of Political Secretary to the Prime Minister Murad Khan to offer condolences on the demise of his father, here on Saturday, he said, “Our policy is very clear, Pakistan will not attack any neighbouring country. However, if anyone attacks us, we will not keep that debt unpaid. This time, the response may not remain zero-six, it could go beyond that.”
He said Pakistan has always supported Afghanistan, but regrettably, the country has repeatedly faced pain and loss from across the border. “We can no longer afford to bury our martyred officers and soldiers. We have clearly conveyed that there must be a distinction between terrorists and ordinary citizens,” he asserted.
Rana Sanaullah Khan said that the PML-N has never supported bans on any political or religious party, emphasizing that peaceful political activity is a democratic right. However, he regretted that “whenever that particular religious party has held demonstrations, the protests have turned violent, resulting in tragic loss of lives.” He said the Punjab government has forwarded its report to the federal government, which will make the final decision on the matter.
He said, “We have never opposed negotiations, but terrorism cannot be tolerated. One cannot kill our soldiers on one hand and then call for talks on the other.” He added that talks can only happen if terrorism ends. “There is no concept of good or bad terrorists, anyone whose ideology is based on violence and opposition to the state cannot be engaged in dialogue.”
Responding to a question, the adviser said that India’s involvement in destabilizing activities in Pakistan is an open secret. “India is so deeply involved that it does not even bother to deny it anymore. However, if India dares any misadventure, our brave armed forces will respond firmly and effectively.”
Commenting on domestic politics, Rana Sanaullah said that Punjab is fully prepared for conducting local government elections. “Chief Minister Maryam Nawaz Sharif has made comprehensive preparations. She wants the local government system to reach every street and neighborhood so that citizens can play their role in governance,” he said.
